official-title.#text:
To provide for congressional oversight of United States
		  agreements with the Government of Afghanistan.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Congressional Oversight of Afghanistan
			 Agreements Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has announced an Enduring Strategic Partnership Agreement between the
			 United States of America and the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan, with the goal
			 of concluding a final agreement between the United States and Afghanistan by
			 May 2, 2013.

quote.#text:
to deter threats
			 against its sovereignty, security, and territorial integrity

text.#text:
The Agreement
			 envisions commitments that directly affect the national security of the United
			 States, including a commitment to assist Afghanistan

The Agreement
			 fails to make clear the future basing structure of United States forces in
			 Afghanistan.

The Agreement
			 fails to specify the future mission profile of United States forces in
			 Afghanistan, the future number of United States forces deployed to Afghanistan,
			 and the length of deployments for United States forces in Afghanistan.

The Agreement
			 fails to specify the extent to which United States military personnel and
			 government contractors will be accountable under the laws of
			 Afghanistan.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is a
			 co-equal branch of government and as such the extension of long-term United
			 States security commitments to Afghanistan that obligates or requires the
			 appropriation of United States funds requires the full participation and
			 consent of
